questions.text: How often must critical suppliers be re-evaluated?

options.explanation: Six months exceeds the minimum frequency for critical suppliers.
Per Section 5.7, critical suppliers are re-evaluated annually.
Biennial re-evaluation applies to non-critical suppliers, not critical ones.
Re-evaluation is scheduled, not only triggered by nonconformances.

questions.text: What approval is required to purchase from a supplier not on the Approved Supplier List?

options.explanation: Department head approval is not sufficient for non-ASL purchases.
Per Section 5.3, purchases from non-ASL suppliers require Quality Manager approval.
Non-ASL purchases require explicit Quality Manager approval.
CEO approval is not specifically required; Quality Manager approval is sufficient.

questions.text: A supplier providing only office supplies would be classified as a critical supplier.
questions.explanation: Per Section 5.1, critical suppliers are those whose products or services directly affect device safety or regulatory compliance. Office supplies are non-critical.

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a supplier evaluation criterion?

options.explanation: Quality capability is a required evaluation criterion.
Company age is not an evaluation criterion. Criteria include quality capability, technical capability, regulatory compliance, financial stability, and security posture.
Technical capability is a required evaluation criterion.
Security posture is a required criterion for cloud/infrastructure suppliers.

questions.text: What must be verified when receiving a SOUP software component?

options.explanation: SOUP source code review is not a standard incoming verification step.

options.text: Version, integrity check, and license compliance
options.explanation: Per Section 5.6, software component verification includes version verification, integrity check (checksums), and license compliance.
Developer certifications are not an incoming verification requirement.
Community popularity metrics are not part of formal incoming verification.
